meanings.definition: Wrong in one's opinion or judgment.
meanings.sent1: She was mistaken about the time of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He realized he had been mistaken about the direction to the store.
meanings.sent3: The mistaken belief that cats can fly led to a funny misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: Her mistaken assumption that all snakes are poisonous put her in danger.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his mistaken decision were severe.

meanings.definition: Based on a misunderstanding or error.
meanings.sent1: Their mistaken interpretation of the map led them astray.
meanings.sent2: The mistaken identity of the suspect caused delays in the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The mistaken idea that socks are a type of fruit made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mistaken belief that the moon is made of cheese is a common misconception.
meanings.sent5: The mistaken assumption that all birds can talk is a popular myth.

meanings.sent1: The mistaken calculation resulted in the wrong answer.
meanings.sent2: Her mistaken memory of the event caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: The mistaken notion that ice cream is a healthy breakfast choice made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The mistaken idea that the Earth is flat has been debunked by science.
meanings.sent5: The mistaken belief that all spiders are harmful led to unnecessary fear.
